html.h1: Welcome in Netfilter Iptables for Splunk, IP Firewall for Linux Systems

row.html:
1. INTRODUCTION
The Netfilter Iptables Application for Splunk intends to exploit Iptables logs generated by Linux based systems to provide main Network informations.
Associated with Splunk's power, the App provides a nice frontend for Iptables and will offer you the global knowledge of your Network Activity.

2. PREREQUISITES
Only internal Splunk modules are being used, the Netfilter Iptables App has no requirements but Splunk 6.1 as the minimal version

3. INSTALLATION
The Application intends to index Iptables Syslog events in the Splunk data index:
iptables_index
Events identifications are associated with the sourcetype configuration contained in:
iptables_source
For more simplicity, i would advise configuring your system to generate a dedicated Iptables log file which only contain Iptables events.
This can be achieved with simple configuration in the host syslog system, configuration samples are provided above
If you intend to have multiple hosts, then you have multiple solutions:
Using Splunk Forwarders with a minimal configuration to send events to your Splunk indexers
Using a syslog centalized system that will receive events from remote hosts and store them in files that will be indexed by Splunk

html.b: Upgrading the Application is very simple and shall be done through the standard Splunk procedure, you may proceed as following:

lu.li: Through the Application Management, when an update has been detected by Splunk, follow the update link and update the App
Download the new App version from Splunk Base, open the App management and update the Application
Download the new App version file, and untar it manaually to $SPLUNK_HOME/etc/apps
